Patient states "I've been having chest pain" that started yesterday. She's a 62-year-old female with history of hypertension—currently on amlodipine 5mg daily… Reports pain is 6/10, described as "pressure-like."

Vitals – BP 152/94, pulse 76, RR 18, temp 98.6°F, O₂ sat 96%

Physical exam reveals she's alert and oriented. Heart sounds are normal—no murmurs, rubs, or gallops. Lungs are clear throughout.

Assessment:
• Atypical chest pain – r/o ACS
• HTN – suboptimal control

Plan:
Obtain ECG, troponin levels. Start aspirin 325mg if enzymes elevated. Consider stress testing if enzymes negative. Uptitrate antihypertensive medication.
